tweets.text: @OwenPaterson @FarmersWeekly @EnvAgency Now we are out of the EU, should we not start dredging again? And let farmers manage their own drains, ditches and waterways?

WALLEY'S QUARRY

I received a huge number of complaints about odour in the area last night and met with Councillor @SimonTagg today to discuss this.

We need to see more action on this from @EnvAgencyMids this year - please report all instances of odour to them on 0800 80 70 60. https://t.co/iQlMlIsJvu

@MonicaHone @EnvAgencyAnglia Great. Thanks for your efforts EA! There is still significant flow of oil along this river today. The smell is still acute. Then there is the clean up- vegetation for miles along this river coated. It flooded into 4 county wildlife sites and further into the broads...
@AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/b9xEEWp5np

urls.description: Farmers in Shropshire have raised concerns about proposals to build a dam on the River Severn that could flood thousands of hectares of productive

tweets.text:
Good article @FarmersWeekly. Arbitrarily damming the River Severn affects #NorthShropshire badly. We must work with English and Welsh authorities to manage the whole river system. IDBs maintaining drains and sluices, @EnvAgency to dredge rivers.
https://t.co/LbB7crn8X0

A quick trip to see how our work to stabilise spoil heaps and reduce pollution has held up to #stormbella - the good news is it's looking üëå. The snow was pretty good too. @EnvAgencyYNE @CoalAuthority #Nenthead #reducepollution #loveyourtyne https://t.co/0DO2s380La

@gemmafreshwater @NewForestNPA @EnvAgencySE @EngNewForest @RealNewForest @HantsIWWildlife That's brilliant! Thanks and well done  :-)  

How about initiating a project to better understand and manage the New Forest's wonderful temporary streams? https://t.co/CA5aQdo5Jt

A large jack up barge left the River Hull today after being used for 2 years to install 650m of piling as part of the ¬£62.4 million project to improve the defences.

The project will better protect more than 60,000 homes and businesses in #Hull from #flooding. https://t.co/mSz0MNyagO
@YISF__INNS @JorvikAngler @YorksWildlife @YorkDalesRT @Jack_Hirst3 @EnvAgencyYNE @WildTroutTrust They will be. Rather long day yesterday...

urls.title: Planners give green light to Otter Valley project
urls.description: A project to help a river valley adapt to climate change and create an internationally important wildlife reserve now has planning permission.

tweets.text:
Our plan to restore the floodplain of the lower River Otter on England‚Äôs Jurassic Coast has been approved by @eastdevon.

Work will start soon to help the valley adapt to climate change and create an internationally important wildlife reserve.

Read more: https://t.co/IrOjgPdF1f
